title: 105_s1411
content: DEDUCTION DISALLOWED FOR CERTAIN TOBACCO COMPANY PAYMENTS. Section 162 of the Internal Revenue Code is amended to disallow deductions for payments made to the government related to tobacco judgments or settlements. Taxpayers must report these payments on their tax returns as prescribed by the Secretary. The term "applicable tobacco judgment or settlement" refers to any civil action judgment or settlement related to tobacco products, including the tobacco industry settlement agreement of June 20, 1997. This definition also encompasses laws enacted to implement such settlements. The amendments made by this section apply to payments made on or after November ____, 1997, pursuant to any judgment or settlement agreement. The tobacco industry settlement agreement of June 20, 1997, will be treated as entered into on the date of the enactment of Federal legislation implementing the agreement. The National Institutes of Health Trust Fund for Health Research is established under the Internal Revenue Code of 1986. The National Institutes of Health Trust Fund for Health Research is created in the Treasury of the United States, funded by appropriations and transfers from revenues generated by section 162(o) of the Internal Revenue Code. The Secretary of Health and Human Services is responsible for distributing the funds in the Trust Fund each fiscal year. Services shall distribute 2 percent of funds to the Office of the Director of the National Institutes of Health for various purposes including research on women's health, minority health, alternative medicine, rare diseases, behavioral and social sciences research, dietary supplements, disease prevention, and construction/acquisition of equipment or facilities. The National Institutes of Health allocates funds to various centers and institutes, including the Office of AIDS Research, based on annual appropriations Acts. 2 percent of the funds are transferred to the National Center for Research Resources for Biomedical and Behavioral Research Facilities under section 1502 of the National Institutes of Health Revitalization Act of 1993. The National Institutes of Health allocates funds to member institutes and Centers based on annual appropriations Acts. The Director of NIH or institute directors allocate transferred amounts according to advisory council plans. Grants and contracts funded under these allocations are fully funded in the first year and remain available until expended. The funds allocated by the National Institutes of Health for grants and contracts are fully funded in the first year and remain available until expended. Expenditures are subject to triggers and releases based on annual appropriations, with a phased distribution plan implemented by the Secretary of Health and Human Services. The Trust Fund distributes 50% in the second fiscal year, 75% in the third year, and 100% in the fourth year onwards. Amounts in the Trust Fund are excluded from budget enforcement procedures. The Deficit Control Act of 1985 includes a conforming amendment to the table of sections for subchapter A. Sec. 9512. National Institutes of Health Trust Fund for Health Research.
